original_table_html:
OBJECTIVE 1-1 What Is Marketing? (pp 28–30)
OBJECTIVE 1-2 Explain the importance of understanding the marketplace and customers and identify the five core marketplace concepts.
Understanding the Marketplace and Customer Needs (pp 30–34)
OBJECTIVE 1-3 Identify the key elements of a customer value–driven marketing strategy and discuss the marketing management orientations that guide marketing strategy.
Designing a Customer Value–Driven Marketing Strategy and Plan (pp 34–38)
OBJECTIVE 1-4 Discuss customer relationship management and identify strategies for creating value for customers and capturing value from customers in return.
Managing Customer Relationships and Capturing Customer Value (pp 38–46)
OBJECTIVE 1-5 Describe the major trends and forces that are changing the marketing landscape in this age of relationships.
The Changing Marketing Landscape (pp 46–55)
summary_markdown: This table outlines five learning objectives related to foundational marketing concepts, structured hierarchically and progressively. Objective 1-1 introduces the fundamental definition of marketing. Building upon this, Objective 1-2 emphasizes the critical importance of comprehending the marketplace and customer needs, identifying five core marketplace concepts. Objective 1-3 then delves into designing a customer value-driven marketing strategy, including a discussion of marketing management orientations. Objective 1-4 focuses on managing customer relationships, detailing strategies for both creating customer value and capturing value in return. Finally, Objective 1-5 addresses the dynamic nature of marketing by describing major trends and forces shaping the current marketing landscape, particularly in the context of evolving relationships.
